title: About
text:
I’m a MS student in Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins University, where I focus on clinical and health data analysis. I’m passionate about using statistics to support evidence-based decision-making in biotech and pharmaceutical industries. My research interest focused on health policy, aging and clinical trial.






M.S. in Biostatistics
Focus: Statistical Methods, Health data analysis



B.A. in Statistical & Data Science and Psychology
Developed an interdisciplinary foundation combining data science, psychology, and human-centered research.









Research Assistant (CDC Influenza Forecasting)
- Cleaned and analyzed CDC influenza surveillance data in R.
- Built Shiny dashboards for real-time epidemic forecasts across U.S. regions.
- Delivered a summary presentation to CDC collaborators.



Research Assistant (Education Analytics)
- Processed pre-/post-course survey data (~40 students).
- Performed regression and visualization to evaluate learning outcomes.
- Conducted basic text analysis for open-ended feedback.



Research Assistant (Policy Diffusion Project)
- Maintained a longitudinal policy dataset (n=1500+) on GitHub.
- Applied IRT models in R to study diffusion of state policies.
- Designed static and interactive visualizations with ggplot2 and plotly.



Research Intern (Precision Agriculture)
- Processed 1.8 GB of satellite imagery using Python and ENVI.
- Automated Excel reporting with Python, reducing 5+ hours/week of manual work.
- Built classification algorithms to assess agricultural risk levels.







Languages: R, Python
Statistical Methods: Regression (linear, logistic), GAMs, mixed models, survival analysis, IRT models

Visualization: ggplot2, plotly, Shiny dashboards, Power BI

Version Control & Reporting: GitHub, Markdown, LaTeX

Domain Expertise: Clinical trial data, epidemiology, survey analysis, geospatial imagery

title: Welcome
text:
Hi, I’m Yujie
I am a first year biostatistics master student at JHSPH interested in health policy, aging and clinical trial. I come from China, did my undergrads in Smith College, MA. In my free time, I love playing guitar, making clay arts and traveling! I also really love nature ：）

title: About
text: Outside of analytics, I enjoy photography, art, and exploring how design and data visualization can create inclusive and accessible spaces.
